definition: paternal aunt/husband's sister/husband's mother (old)/nun/for the time being (literary)

sentences.english: On my way home I stopped at my aunt's.
sentences.chinese: 回家途中我順便到姑媽那兒去了一會兒。

sentences.english: B. The food tasted bad, however Aunt Kit fixed it.
sentences.chinese: 飯菜不好喫，可姬特姑媽還往裏加調味料。

sentences.english: Mary boards at her aunt 's sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 有時，瑪麗在她的姑媽家包飯。

sentences.english: My aunt never drank alcohol or smoked. Her cancer was completely caused by pollution.
sentences.chinese: 我姑媽從來不抽菸喝酒，她的癌症肯定是污染引起的。

sentences.english: A dissentient opinion came from the aunt .
sentences.chinese: 姑媽卻提出不贊同的意見。

sentences.english: 10/Aunt Mary was never one to fuss about unimportant things.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗姑媽永遠不會在不重要的事情上瞎忙。

sentences.english: "Grandpa's mima" he explained to me one day.
sentences.chinese: “爺爺的姑媽，”父親有一天對我解釋說。

sentences.english: After being absent from The Gables for a week.
sentences.chinese: 一次，姑媽有一個星期沒在“山牆莊園”住。

sentences.english: Her aunt is a pompous and proud--and fat--old lady.
sentences.chinese: 她姑媽是個浮誇自負的胖老太太。

sentences.english: Frank, how'd you like to drive me out to my Aunt Pitty's?
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭克，你願意送我到我的琵蒂姑媽那去嗎？

sentences.english: Aunt Harriet could not find words to praise Bessie's industriousness and efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 哈麗特姑媽簡直不知該怎麼誇讚貝西的勤勞能幹纔好。

sentences.english: Aunt Lucy has just left for America.
My aunt pulled out a small silver heart.
sentences.chinese: 我的姑媽掏出一隻小銀心。

sentences.english: My aunt made me a big doll out of towels.
sentences.chinese: 我的姑媽用毛巾給我做了一個大布娃娃。

sentences.english: My aunt used to live in this part of Michigan that was kind of out in the country.
sentences.chinese: 我姑媽曾住在這個國家中密西根州的一個地區。

sentences.english: They’re all as fat as Susie’s aunt.
sentences.chinese: 他們就象蘇絲的姑媽一樣胖。

definition: adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
daughter's son/grandson/descendant via the female line
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
